result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
With case 22CM275
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Emma Guthrie is appointed as counsel.
Defendant to pay $500 by 10/1/22
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 11/1/2022.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 04:45 pm.

1:37 PM Defendant Ricky Allen Schlafke in court.  Attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Def does not qualify for public defender, Def did not look for an atty yet. Court will appoint an atty (Emma Guthrie), Def will pay $500.00 deposit by 10-31-22 then $100.00 per month commencing 11-1-22. 950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 04:45 pm.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Ricky Allen Schlafke appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advises he would still like to seek counsel, JA advises him that he stated the same thing at the last Scheduling Conference and the JA at that time have told him that he needed to contact the Public Defender's Office right away and if he was denied he was to come to the Clerk of Courts Office to complete court appointed counsel paperwork
Defendant state that he did pick the paperwork up but he has not filled it out yet. JA advises that it needs to be completed and filed within the next couple of days
950/Marcy's Law compliant

11:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ricky Allen Schlafke in court. Given complaint-Advised of Rights-Bond set-Probable cause found-Deft. does not know what to plea-Court enters not guilty plea- 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim makes statement to court. Deft. to reside with father. Case to go to branch 1-Court amends complaint orally on the record so the bond can contain the condition-to not consume alcoholic beverages. State to amend complaint.
